segments.en: Linked Discourses 56
4. In a Rosewood Forest
31. In a Rosewood Forest

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kosambiyaṃ viharati sīsapāvane.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Kosambī in a rosewood forest.

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā parittāni sīsapāpaṇṇāni pāṇinā gahetvā bhikkhū āmantesi:
segments.en: Then the Buddha picked up a few rosewood leaves in his hand and addressed the mendicants:
“What do you think, mendicants?
Which is more:

segments.pli: yāni vā mayā parittāni sīsapāpaṇṇāni pāṇinā gahitāni yadidaṃ upari sīsapāvane”ti?
segments.en: the few leaves in my hand, or those in the forest above me?”

segments.pli: “Appamattakāni, bhante, bhagavatā parittāni sīsapāpaṇṇāni pāṇinā gahitāni;
segments.en: “Sir, the few leaves in your hand are a tiny amount.

segments.pli: atha kho etāneva bahutarāni yadidaṃ upari sīsapāvane”ti.
segments.en: There are far more leaves in the forest above.”

segments.pli: “Evameva kho, bhikkhave, etadeva bahutaraṃ yaṃ vo mayā abhiññāya anakkhātaṃ.
segments.en: “In the same way, there is much more that I have directly known but have not explained to you. What I have explained is a tiny amount.
And why haven’t I explained it?

segments.pli: Na hetaṃ, bhikkhave, atthasaṃhitaṃ nādibrahmacariyakaṃ na nibbidāya na virāgāya na nirodhāya na upasamāya na abhiññāya na sambodhāya na nibbānāya saṃvattati;
segments.en: Because it’s not beneficial or relevant to the fundamentals of the spiritual life. It doesn’t lead to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.
That’s why I haven’t explained it.
And what have I explained?

segments.pli: ‘Idaṃ dukkhan’ti, bhikkhave, mayā akkhātaṃ, ‘ayaṃ dukkhasamudayo’ti mayā akkhātaṃ, ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodho’ti mayā akkhātaṃ, ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti mayā akkhātaṃ.
segments.en: I have explained: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
And why have I explained this?

segments.pli: Etañhi, bhikkhave, atthasaṃhitaṃ etaṃ ādibrahmacariyakaṃ etaṃ nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattati;
segments.en: Because it’s beneficial and relevant to the fundamentals of the spiritual life. It leads to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.
That’s why I’ve explained it.

segments.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yogo karaṇīyo … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yogo karaṇīyo”ti.
segments.en: That’s why you should practice meditation …”

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Kosambī…

suttaplex.blurb: In a siṁsapā grove, the Buddha holds up a handful of leaves, and compares it to all the leaves in the forest. So too, he has taught the four noble truths, which is only a fraction of what he knows.
